conclusion: Determine how much the point source S should be moved vertically upward so that the light emitted from it is just not visible above the water surface.
Using the concept of total internal reflection and the critical angle.
Calculate the critical angle C for total internal reflection using sin C = 1/n where n = sqrt(2), resulting in C = 45 degrees.
A circular wooden board with radius r and a point light source S at depth H = sqrt(3)r.
The light ray travels at the critical angle C = 45 degrees.
For the light to be just visible at the surface, the ray must reach the edge of the board at the critical angle, forming a right triangle with opposite side r and adjacent side h.
Using tan 45 degrees = r/h = 1, implying h = r.
Calculate the vertical upward movement Delta h as H - h = sqrt(3)r - r = (sqrt(3) - 1)r.
The point source S should be moved vertically upward by a distance of (sqrt(3) - 1)r.
The light source S should be moved upward by a distance of (sqrt(3) - 1)r so that the light is just not visible above the water surface.
